item.title: How I built this static site with Next.JS
item.description: A quick look at how I made a site that has almost no JavaScript, using a JavaScript framework.
item.author: matt.e.greer@gmail.com (Matt Greer)

item.title: Extracting Neo Geo Emulator Graphics Data to Create Animated gifs
item.description: Web Assembly lets us bring native applications right into the browser. By porting a game emulator to Web Assembly, I was able to reach into its memory to build animated gifs.
item.author: matt.e.greer@gmail.com (Matt Greer)

item.title: Squeezing the Arduboy For Every Byte
item.description: The Arduboy is an Arduino based game console with very limited storage space. This article shows some techniques I used to use the space efficiently.
item.author: matt.e.greer@gmail.com (Matt Greer)

item.title: MATE and i3
item.description: How to use i3 with MATE to get an excellent tiling desktop experience in Linux.
item.author: matt.e.greer@gmail.com (Matt Greer)

item.title: React Internals Part Five: Transactions
item.description: In this final installment, we take a quick look at transactions and how they help React do its job.
item.author: matt.e.greer@gmail.com (Matt Greer)

item.title: React Internals Part Four: setState
item.description: Part four implements setState, an important function that drives much of what React does.
item.author: matt.e.greer@gmail.com (Matt Greer)

item.title: React Internals Part Three: Basic Updating
item.description: This part explores how React updates the DOM after props change.
item.author: matt.e.greer@gmail.com (Matt Greer)

item.title: React Internals Part Two: component足Will足Mount and component足Did足Mount
item.description: Today we are looking at how lifecycle methods in React work.
item.author: matt.e.greer@gmail.com (Matt Greer)

item.title: React Internals Part One: Basic Rendering
item.description: This article series creates a small clone of React to learn how it works. We kick things off with the most basic of rendering.
item.author: matt.e.greer@gmail.com (Matt Greer)

item.title: Electron, Redux and Persistence
item.description: A strategy for persisting state in a Redux based Electron app.
item.author: matt.e.greer@gmail.com (Matt Greer)

item.title: The Sega Saturn and Transparency
item.description: The Saturn's complex hardware architecture meant implementing semi-transparent entities in a game was challenging. This interactive article explains the conundrum, and shows why game developers often settled for inferior alternatives.
item.author: matt.e.greer@gmail.com (Matt Greer)

item.title: Impromptu Web Scraping
item.description: The browser's dev console can be a nice tool to extract data from a webpage.
item.author: matt.e.greer@gmail.com (Matt Greer)

item.title: Embedding SVG Into a Reagent Component
item.description: Using Clojure macros to embed an SVG into a Reagent component.
item.author: matt.e.greer@gmail.com (Matt Greer)

item.title: A Game Made With Reagent
item.description: For the heck of it, I made a simple breakout game with Reagent
item.author: matt.e.greer@gmail.com (Matt Greer)

item.title: ClojureScript Internals: Vectors
item.description: A detailed dive into how vectors in ClojureScript work.
item.author: matt.e.greer@gmail.com (Matt Greer)

item.title: Reagent Rocks!
item.description: Reagent is a ClojureScript interface to React, and it is incredible.
item.author: matt.e.greer@gmail.com (Matt Greer)

item.title: Pair Programming Is Not a Panacea
item.description: Pair programming can be great, but it can also be terrible. This article explores when to pair, when not to, and why some of us don't like it.
item.author: matt.e.greer@gmail.com (Matt Greer)

item.title: JavaScript Promises ... in Wicked Detail
item.description: A detailed article that implements a simple Promise type from scratch. By building the Promise implementation gradually, it shows the why and how of Promises.
item.author: matt.e.greer@gmail.com (Matt Greer)

item.title: Dynamic Lighting and Shadows In My 2D Game
item.description: How I used shaders in WebGL to accomplish lighting and shadows in a 2D game.
item.author: matt.e.greer@gmail.com (Matt Greer)

item.title: Waking Up At 5am To Code
item.description: For a while I woke up early to work on projects before going to work. Here's a quick summary of how it went.
item.author: matt.e.greer@gmail.com (Matt Greer)
